intro: Strychnos penduliflora, commonly known as the hanging-flower strychnos, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 3 meters in height. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that hang in pendulous inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds covered in a sticky, fleshy coating. The plant is part of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its ornamental value and unique floral structure.
